newsitem.title: SPAIN: Peseta debt/interbank market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Peseta debt/interbank market closing report.

text.p: Spanish government bonds ended Thursday little changed, off the day's high after a roller-coaster day.
They opened down then recovered on the cut in the official rate but fell again on profit-taking to end near the day's low.
"It is very likely we will see further correction on Friday," a dealer at Bank of America in Madrid said, adding that the December future could fall to 106.50.
The short-end gained the most, while the dealers said they expected one-to-three year bonds to stay firm. "We will see a steepening in the curve," one said.
